When disabling redrawing on a text viewer, we disable redrawing of the text 
widget and also cut the event flow between the document and the text widget. 
Document and text widget are coupled by the DefaultDocumentAdapter. When 
during the disabled period the text widget is accessed in a way that is has to 
call back to the document adapter, there might be a discrepancy between the 
state the text widget believes its content (i.e. document) is in and the 
actual state of the document. This is because of the temporarily stopped event 
flow.

When cutting the event flow, the adapter needs to make a copy of the original 
document and use this copy for any request that comes from the widget as long 
as the event loop is not re-established.

patch for the org.eclipse.jface.text plug-in

The following changes have been applied to the patch:
- the document clone is created lazily based on remembered content
  and line delimiters
- the clone is reset on setDocument
